definition: to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc

sentences.english: Follow of Kelaili only the mandolin musical instrument with a lonely divert oneself from loneliness or boredom.
sentences.chinese: 跟隨柯萊利的唯有一把排遣孤寂的曼陀林琴。

sentences.english: Writing was the only way to relieve my loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 寫作是我排遣寂寞的唯一方法。

sentences.english: Most recently, he had learned because of distraction Fan Xinshi a good variety of magic.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他因爲排遣煩心事而學會了好多種魔術。

sentences.english: In Africa you can't walk in the countryside and think.
sentences.chinese: 在非洲，你沒法信步閒庭似的走在鄉間排遣思緒。

sentences.english: Phoebe helps Monica try to relax.
sentences.chinese: 菲比幫助莫妮卡排遣痛苦。

sentences.english: Is there any better ways to beguile loneliness except eating?
sentences.chinese: 排遣寂寞，除了喫之外，還有什麼更好的方法呢？

sentences.english: She beguiled her sorrow with music.
sentences.chinese: 她借音樂來排遣內心的憂傷。

sentences.english: I contemplated whether or not Rewi Alley likewise intended to relieve his loneliness as he persisted in poetry translation.
sentences.chinese: 我尋思，他堅持譯詩是否也意欲排遣孤寂落寞之感呢？

sentences.english: Working is a good way to overcome loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 工作是排遣寂寞的一個好辦法。

definition: to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of
to relieve boredom or melancholy/a diversion
to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
lit. to eliminate worry and dispel melancholy (idiom); diversion from boredom/to dispel depression or melancholy/to relieve stress/a relaxing pass-time
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
to while the time away/amusement/pastime/recreation/to make sport of
